thread.title: Olvera: ‘They have to go back to work’: Mohave ready for Homecoming Game against familiar Broncs
thread.title_full: Olvera: ‘They have to go back to work’: Mohave ready for Homecoming Game against familiar Broncs

author: DANIEL McKILLOP The Daily News
title: Olvera: ‘They have to go back to work’: Mohave ready for Homecoming Game against familiar Broncs
text:
DANIEL McKILLOP/The Daily News HEAVYWEIGHT BOUT 
HEAVYWEIGHT BOUT: Patriots offensive lineman Abel Ortiz (74) and Cougars defensive lineman Andrew Estes (50) go at it during MALC’s win at Laughlin on Aug. 27. Posted: Friday, October 2, 2015 12:35 am | Updated: 12:44 am, Fri Oct 2, 2015. MALC will try to get on track By DANIEL McKILLOP The Daily News MohaveDailyNews.com | 0 comments 
BULLHEAD CITY — The Patriots have run into two buzz-saws in as many weeks, and the Mohave Accelerated Learning Center football team will try to get in the winning column at 7 tonight at Firebird Field against the North Pointe Falcons. 
The Patriots fell 47-7 to Scottsdale Christian on Sept. 18 and 45-0 to Tonopah High School on Sept. 25. 
The Patriots are 1-5 overall and the Falcons are 1-4 overall coming into the Arizona Interscholastic Association Division V football game. 
“They’re a spread team,” said Patriots head coach Steve Price about the Falcons’ offensive scheme. “I’m getting tired of these spread teams.” 
Scottsdale Christian and Tonopah each used spread formations. 
“I think they’re pretty much 50-50 run to pass,” said Price about the Falcons’ offensive tendencies. 
The Patriots’ first-year head coach said the Falcons play a 4-4 defensive formation. 
“They’ve got a little size,” Price said, “but at this point everybody looks like everybody has a little bit more speed than we do — more team speed, we’ve got some individuals who can run like deer, but not overall team speed. 
“That will be a good matchup for us tomorrow.” 
Price said Clay Merrigan, who has done a “good job” moving from free safety to running back, had a “good week” at practice. 
Jackson Werchau “has really started to pick it up” this week, Price said. 
“I think, overall as a team, we’ve picked up at practice this week and the intensity of it,” Price said. “So, I’m more excited about that than anything else at this point.” 
Price added: “It’s a tough schedule; it’s not an easy schedule. We’re doing our best to get on the right track and do some positve things.”
